member.name: T:systar.isystain.shared.BaseTypes.Common.BaseBackgroundJob
member.summary: This is a POCO object designed to work as a DTO within the iSystain Background processing framework. Adding a new type of job should be registered in the BackgroundJobType enum above Any parameters should be serialised externally and save as a XML text string here. The POCO will have no knowledge of the types

member.name: T:systar.isystain.shared.BaseTypes.Common.BaseBlob
member.summary:
This POCO class is used to define a base text blob object. The intent here is to provide a common set of objects and methods applications can use to store large text values. Each value is referenced by the BobId guid which would be stored as a foreign key in the related object. This assumes a one - to - one relationship but other tables can be created to store collections of blobs if necessary.
The main advantage of this is that the SQL performance on the driving tables is improved as each record doesn't need to pull in other database pages in a linked list in the event the record size exceeds 8k.

member.name: P:systar.isystain.shared.Locations.CompanyID
member.summary:
The main location class encapsulated the idea of managing geographical locations
The Locations class is a mega-class that only contains other sub classes and constructors The data access layer is passed in as an argument and should be set immediately following instantiation.
Programmers should always instantiate the location subclasses using the locations.New{site/location etc} If not, the DAL will not be in the object's scope

member.name: T:systar.isystain.shared.Locations.LocationType
member.summary: The Location.Map class manages the relationship of qra objects to location objects. The class is hierarchical in that a qra obj can have many locations in an ordered hierarchy

member.name: T:systar.isystain.shared.Entities
member.summary: The Entities class is a generic structure to handle all the various identity objects in a consistent way. This object is used heavily in the kpi module to manage the various associations QRA data has to the org structure. This includes relating data to sites, assets, processes, businesses, divisions, complexes etc.

member.name: M:systar.isystain.shared.Entities.DisableAll
member.summary: Disables all entities currently in this class

member.name: T:systar.isystain.shared.Organisation
member.summary: This class maintains all business logic surrounding the company heirarchy. This includes the roles, teams, departments, divisions and businesses relevant to each company

member.name: T:systar.isystain.shared.Settings
member.summary:
The Settings class is responsible for managing collections of company specific configuration settings. This used to be stored in the web.config however with the move to a centralised 'shared' database for all systain customers it's necessary to implement all company settings into the database.
All settings are persisted by storing them in the ref_setting table. Each setting record is keyed by the company it belongs to.

member.summary: Return the logical start date of the relevant fiscal year

member.name: M:systar.isystain.shared.DbTools.GetReader(System.String)
member.summary: This routine is useful if you want to get every row in a table in an efficient way Loading into a dataset is inefficient as it needs to load everything at once. This routine will return a reader to the caller so that they can get each row one at a time.
